name: src/cj.js
Collection
description: Collection+Json utility object.

name: getErrorMessage
description: Get the error message from the collection object.

return.description: error message

name: getLinkRelationUrls
description: Get the list of urls for a link relation from a collection or item object.

return.description: list of urls

name: getItemDescriptors
description: Get an item's data (descriptors).

return.description: object whose properties and values are the item's descriptor names and values respectively

name: getUrl
description: Get the url of the representation given by a collection obj.

return.description: url of the resource representation

name: getTotalNumberOfItems
description: Get the total number of items from a collection object.

return.description:
total number of items or -1 if the collection objects
doesn't contain that information

name: getTemplateDescriptorNames
description: Get the list of descriptor names within a collection's template object.

return.description: list of descriptor names

name: getQueryParameters
description: Get the list of descriptor names within a Collection+Json query array.

return.description: list of query parameter names

name: createCollectionObj
description: Create an empty Collection+Json object.

return.description: template object

name: makeTemplate
description:
Make a Collection+Json template object from a regular object whose properties are
the item descriptors.

return.description: template object

Client

description: Constructor

return.description: JS Promise

name: getChrisInstance
description: Get the ChRIS instance resource object.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``ChrisInstance`` object

name: getFeeds
description:
Get a paginated list of currently authenticated user's feeds
from the REST API given query search parameters. If no search parameters
then get the default first page.

params.name: searchParams.id
params.description: match feed id exactly with this number

params.name: searchParams.min_id
params.description: match feed id gte this number

params.name: searchParams.max_id
params.description: match feed id lte this number

params.name: searchParams.name
params.description: match feed name containing this string

params.name: searchParams.name_exact
params.description: match feed name exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.name_startswith
params.description: match feed name starting with this string

params.name: searchParams.files_fname_icontains
params.description:
match the feeds that have files containing
all the substrings from the queried string (which in turn represents a white-space-separated list
of query strings) case insensitive anywhere in their fname.

params.name: searchParams.min_creation_date
params.description: match feed creation date gte this date

params.name: searchParams.max_creation_date
params.description: match feed creation date lte this date

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``FeedList`` object

name: getFeed
description: Get a feed resource object given its id.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``Feed`` object

name: tagFeed
description: Tag a feed given its id and the id of the tag.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``Tagging`` object

name: getFiles
description:
Get a paginated list of files written to any user-owned feed from the REST
API given query search parameters. If no search parameters then get the
default first page.

params.name: searchParams.id
params.description: match file id exactly with this number

params.name: searchParams.fname
params.description: match file's path starting with this string

params.name: searchParams.fname_exact
params.description: match file's path exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.fname_icontains
params.description: match file's path containing this string

params.name: searchParams.fname_nslashes
params.description: match file's upload path containing this number of slashes

params.name: searchParams.plugin_inst_id
params.description:
match the associated plugin instance
id exactly with this number

params.name: searchParams.feed_id
params.description: match the associated feed id exactly with this number

params.name: searchParams.min_creation_date
params.description: match file's creation_date greater than this date string

params.name: searchParams.max_creation_date
params.description: match file's creation_date lesser than this date string

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``AllFeedFileList`` object

name: getFile
description: Get a file resource object given its id.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``FeedFile`` object

name: getComputeResources
description:
Get a paginated list of compute resources from the REST API given query
search parameters. If no search parameters then get the default first page.

params.name: searchParams.id
params.description: match file id exactly with this number

params.name: searchParams.name
params.description: match compute resource's name containing this string

params.name: searchParams.name_exact
params.description: match compute resource's name exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.description
params.description: match compute resource's description containing this string

params.name: searchParams.plugin_id
params.description:
match plugin id exactly with this string for all the
compute resources associated with the plugin

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``ComputeResourceList`` object

name: getComputeResource
description: Get a compute resource object given its id.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``ComputeResource`` object

params.name: searchParams.name

params.name: searchParams.title

params.name: searchParams.category
params.description: match plugin meta category exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.type
params.description: match plugin meta type exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.authors
params.description: match plugin meta authors containing this string

params.name: searchParams.min_creation_date
params.description: match plugin meta creation date gte this date

params.name: searchParams.max_creation_date
params.description: match plugin meta creation date lte this date

params.name: searchParams.name_title_category
params.description:
match plugin meta name, title or
category containing this string

params.name: searchParams.name_authors_category
params.description:
match plugin meta name, authors or
category containing this string

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``PluginMetaList`` object

description: Get a plugin meta resource object given its id.

params.description: match plugin id exactly with this number

params.description: match plugin name exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.version
params.description: match plugin version exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.dock_image
params.description: match plugin docker image exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.type
params.description: match plugin type exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.category
params.description: match plugin category containing this string

params.name: searchParams.title

params.name: searchParams.description
params.description: match plugin description containing this string

params.name: searchParams.min_creation_date
params.description: match plugin creation date gte this date

params.name: searchParams.max_creation_date
params.description: match plugin creation date lte this date

params.name: searchParams.name_title_category
params.description:
match plugin name, title or
category containing this string

params.name: searchParams.compute_resource_id
params.description:
match plugin's compute resource id exactly
with this number

description: Get a plugin resource object given its id.

list of names of already registered compute resources

name: getPluginInstances
description:
Get a paginated list of plugin instances from the REST API given query search
parameters. If no search parameters then get the default first page.

params.name: searchParams.id
params.description: match plugin instance id exactly with this number

params.name: searchParams.title
params.description: match plugin instance title containing this string

params.name: searchParams.status
params.description: match plugin instance execution status exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.owner_username
params.description: match plugin instances's owner username exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.feed_id
params.description: match associated feed's id exactly with this number

params.name: searchParams.workflow_id
params.description: match associated workflows's id exactly with this number

params.name: searchParams.root_id
params.description: match root plugin instance's id exactly with this number

params.name: searchParams.plugin_id
params.description: match associated plugin's id exactly with this number

params.name: searchParams.plugin_name
params.description: match associated plugin's name containing this string

params.name: searchParams.plugin_name_exact
params.description: match associated plugin's name exact with this string

params.name: searchParams.plugin_version
params.description: match associated plugin's verion exactly with this string

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to ``AllPluginInstanceList`` object

params.name: searchParams.name

name: getWorkflows
description:
Get a paginated list of workflows from the REST API given query search
parameters. If no search parameters then get the default first page.

params.name: searchParams.id
params.description: match workflow id exactly with this number

params.name: searchParams.owner_username
params.description: match workflow's owner username exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.pipeline_name
params.description: match associated pipeline name containing this string

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to ``AllWorkflowList`` object

name: getWorkflow
description: Get a workflow resource object given its id.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``Workflow`` object

name: computeWorkflowNodesInfo
description:
Helper method to create the ``nodes_info`` field required by ``createWorkflow`` method's
``data`` argument to create a workflow from a pipeline's default parameters data array
tipically returned by ``Pipeline.getDefaultParameters().data``.

params.name: pipelineDefaultParameters
params.description:
array of objects with the default parameters
as returned by ``Pipeline.getDefaultParameters().data``

params.name: includeAllDefaults
params.description:
if set to `true`` then non-null parameters are also included
in the result

return.description: array of workflow node objects

name: createWorkflow
description: Create a new workflow resource through the REST API.

params.name: data.nodes_info
params.description:
pipeline-specific JSON string encoding a list of objects.
Each object is a workflow node containing a ``piping_id``, ``compute_resource_name``,
``title`` and a list of objects called ``plugin_parameter_defaults``. Each object in
this list has ``name`` and ``default`` properties.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to ``Workflow`` object

name: getPACSFiles
description:
Get a paginated list of PACS files from the REST API given query search
parameters. If no search parameters then get the default first page.

params.name: searchParams.id
params.description: match file id exactly with this number

params.name: searchParams.fname
params.description: match file's path starting with this string

params.name: searchParams.fname_exact
params.description: match file's path exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.fname_icontains
params.description: match file's path containing this string

params.name: searchParams.fname_icontains_topdir_unique
params.description:
match file's path containing all the substrings
from the queried string (which in turn represents a white-space-separated list of query strings) case
insensitive anywhere in their fname. But only one file is returned per toplevel directory under
SERVICES/PACS/pacs_name. This is useful to efficiently determine the top level directories containing a file
that matches the query.

params.name: searchParams.fname_nslashes
params.description: match file's upload path containing this number of slashes

params.name: searchParams.PatientID
params.description: match file's PatientID exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.PatientName
params.description: match file's PatientName containing this string

params.name: searchParams.PatientSex
params.description: match file's PatientSex exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.PatientAge
params.description: match file's PatientAge exactly with this number

params.name: searchParams.min_PatientAge
params.description: match file's PatientAge greater than this number

params.name: searchParams.max_PatientAge
params.description: match file's PatientAge lesser than this number

params.name: searchParams.PatientBirthDate
params.description: match file's PatientBirthDate exactly with this date string

params.name: searchParams.StudyDate
params.description: match file's StudyDate exactly with this date string

params.name: searchParams.AccessionNumber
params.description: match file's AccessionNumber exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.ProtocolName
params.description: match file's ProtocolName exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.StudyInstanceUID
params.description: match file's StudyInstanceUID exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.StudyDescription
params.description: match file's StudyDescription containing this string

params.name: searchParams.SeriesInstanceUID
params.description: match file's SeriesInstanceUID exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.SeriesDescription
params.description: match file's SeriesDescription containing this string

params.name: searchParams.pacs_identifier
params.description: match file's PACS identifier exactly with this string

params.name: searchParams.min_creation_date
params.description: match file's creation_date greater than this date string

params.name: searchParams.max_creation_date
params.description: match file's creation_date lesser than this date string

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``PACSFileList`` object

name: getPACSFile
description: Get a PACS file resource object given its id.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``PACSFile`` object

params.name: searchParams.service_id

params.name: searchParams.min_creation_date
params.description: match file's creation_date greater than this date string

params.name: searchParams.max_creation_date
params.description: match file's creation_date lesser than this date string

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``ServiceFileList`` object

description: Get a service file resource object given its id.

name: src/request.js
Request
description: Http request object.

name: constructor
description: Constructor

name: get
description: Perform a GET request.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to an ``axios reponse`` object

name: post
description: Perform a POST request.

params.name: uploadFileObj
params.description:
custom object with a property with the same name as
the API descriptor corresponding to the file and whose value is the file blob

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to an ``axios reponse`` object

name: put
description: Perform a PUT request.

params.name: uploadFileObj
params.description:
custom object with a property with the same name as
the API descriptor corresponding to the file and whose value is the file blob

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to an ``axios reponse`` object

name: delete
description: Perform a DELETE request.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to an ``axios reponse`` object

name: _postOrPut
description: Internal method to make either a POST or PUT request.

params.name: uploadFileObj
params.description:
custom object with a property with the same name as
the API descriptor corresponding to the file and whose value is the file blob

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to an ``axios reponse`` object

name: _getConfig
description: Internal method to create a config file for axios.

return.description: axios configuration object

name: _callAxios
description: Internal method to make an axios request.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to an ``axios reponse`` object

name: _handleRequestError
description: Internal method to handle errors produced by HTTP requests.

name: runAsyncTask
description: Helper method to run an asynchronous task defined by a task generator function.

name: src/resource.js
Resource
description: API abstract resource class.

name: constructor
description: Constructor

name: isEmpty
description: Return true if the resource object contains any data.

name: clone
description: Make a deep copy clone of this object resource.

return.description: clone object

name: cloneObj
description: Helper method to make a deep copy clone of the passed object resource.

return.description: clone object

name: ItemResource
description: API abstract item resource class.

name: constructor
description: Constructor

name: get
description: Fetch this item resource from the REST API.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to ``this`` object

name: data
description: Get the item's data object (REST API descriptors).

name: getPUTParameters
description:
Get an array of parameter names that can be used as properties of the data
object in PUT requests.

return.description:
array of PUT data property name or null if this list
resource's data has not been fetched from the API yet or it doesn't support
PUT requests.

name: _getResource
description:
Internal method to fetch a related resource from the REST API that is referenced
by a link relation within the item object.

params.name: searchParams
params.description: search parameters object which is resource-specific

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``ResourceClass`` object

throws.description:
throw error if this item resource has not yet been
fetched from the REST API
throw error when the link relation is not found

name: _put
description:
Internal helper method to make a PUT request to this item resource through
the REST API.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to ``this`` object

name: _delete
description:
Internal helper method to make a DELETE request to this item resource through
the REST API.

return.description: JS Promise

name: ListResource
description: API abstract list resource class.

name: constructor
description: Constructor

name: get
description:
Fetch this list resource from the REST API based on search parameters. If
no search parameters then get the default first page.

params.name: searchParams
params.description:
search parameters object which is
resource-specific, the ``getSearchParameters`` method can be used to get a list
of possible search parameters

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to ``this`` object

name: getSearchParameters
description:
Get an array of search parameter names that can be used as properties of the
``searchParams`` argument to the ``get`` method.

return.description:
array of search parameter names or null if this list
resource's data has not been fetched from the API yet.

name: getItem
description:
Get an item resource object given its id from the list of items in this
list resource object.

return.description: an instance of ``this.itemClass``

name: getItems
description:
Get an array of item resource objects corresponding to the items in this
list resource object.

name: data
description: Get the list of item data objects (REST API descriptors).

name: totalCount
description:
Get the total count of items of the entire collection across pages in the
paginated REST API. Return -1 if no data has been fetched or the total
number of items info is not available from the fetched data.

name: hasNextPage
description:
Return true if the list resource object has a next list page in the
paginated REST API.

name: hasPreviousPage
description:
Return true if the list resource object has a previous list page in the
paginated REST API.

name: getPOSTParameters
description:
Get an array of parameter names that can be used as properties of the data
object in POST requests.

return.description:
array of POST data properties or null if this list
resource's data has not been fetched from the API yet or it doesn't support
POST requests.

name: _getResource
description:
Internal method to fetch a related resource from the REST API that is
referenced by a link relation within this list resource's collection object.

params.name: searchParams
params.description: search parameters object which is resource-specific

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``ResourceClass`` object

throws.description:
throw error if this list resource has not yet
been fetched from the REST API
throw error when the link relation is not found

name: _post
description:
Internal helper method to make a POST request to this list resource through
the REST API.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to ``this`` object

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``Tag`` object

name: FeedTagList
description:
Feed-specific tag list resource object representing a list of tags that an specific
feed is tagged with.

name: constructor
description: Constructor

name: getFeed
description: Fetch the feed associated to this feed-specific list of tags from the REST API.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``Feed`` object

name: src/uploadedfile.js
UploadedFile
description: Uploaded file item resource object representing a user's uploaded file.

name: constructor
description: Constructor

name: getFileBlob
description: Fetch the file blob associated to this file item from the REST API.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``Blob`` object

name: put
description: Make a PUT request to modify this uploaded file item resource through the REST API.

params.name: data.upload_path
params.description:
absolute path including file name where the file
will be uploaded on the storage service

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to ``this`` object

name: delete
description: Make a DELETE request to delete this uploaded file item resource through the REST API.

return.description: JS Promise

name: UploadedFileList
description: Uploaded file list resource object representing a list of a user's uploaded files.

name: constructor
description: Constructor

name: post
description:
Make a POST request to this uploaded file list resource to create a new uploaded file
item resource through the REST API.

params.name: data.upload_path
params.description:
absolute path including file name where the file
will be uploaded on the storage service

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to ``this`` object

name: src/user.js
User
description: User item resource object representing a user of the system.

name: constructor
description: Constructor

name: put
description: Make a PUT request to modify this user item resource through the REST API.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to ``this`` object

name: src/workflow.js
Workflow
description: Workflow item resource object representing a pipeline workflow.

name: constructor
description: Constructor

name: getPipeline
description: Fetch the pipeline associated to this workflow from the REST API.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``Pipeline`` object

name: getPluginInstances
description: Fetch a list of plugin instances created by this workflow from the REST API.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``WorkflowPluginInstanceList`` object

name: put
description: Make a PUT request to modify this workflow resource through the REST API.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to ``this`` object

name: delete
description: Make a DELETE request to delete this workflow resource through the REST API.

return.description: JS Promise

name: WorkflowList
description:
Workflow list resource object representing a list of pipeline-specific
workflows.

name: constructor
description: Constructor

name: getPipeline
description: Fetch the pipeline associated to this workflow list from the REST API.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``Pipeline`` object

name: post
description:
Make a POST request to this workflow list resource to create a new
workflow item resource through the REST API.

params.name: data.nodes_info
params.description:
pipeline-specific JSON string encoding a list of dictionaries.
Each dictionary is a workflow node containing a ``plugin piping_id``, ``compute_resource_name``,
``title`` and a list of dictionaries called ``plugin_parameter_defaults``. Each dictionary in
this list has ``name`` and ``default`` keys.

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to ``this`` object

name: AllWorkflowList
description: Workflow list resource object representing a list of all workflows.

name: constructor
description: Constructor

name: getPipelines
description: Fetch a list of pipelines from the REST API.

params.name: searchParams
params.description:
search parameters object which is
resource-specific, the ``PipelineList.getSearchParameters`` method can be
used to get a list of possible search parameters

return.description: JS Promise, resolves to a ``PipelineList`` object

name: ./APIDocumentation.md

content:
{
  "name": "@fnndsc/chrisapi",
  "version": "1.11.0",
  "description": "JavaScript6 client for the ChRIS API",
  "main": "./dist/node/chrisapi.js",
  "browser":"./dist/web/chrisapi.js",
  "types": "./dist/types/index.d.ts",
  "scripts": {
    "build": "tsc && webpack",
    "precommit": "lint-staged",
    "start": "karma start",
    "test": "karma start --single-run",
    "docs": "esdoc -c esdoc.json"
  },
  "lint-staged": {
    "src/**/*.{js,jsx,json,css,ts,tsx}": [
      "prettier --write"
    ],
    "*.{js,jsx,json,css,ts,tsx}": [
      "prettier --write"
    ]
  },
  "prettier": {
    "printWidth": 100,
    "singleQuote": true,
    "trailingComma": "es5",
    "overrides": [
      {
        "files": "*.css",
        "options": {
          "useTabs": false,
          "tabWidth": 2
        }
      }
    ]
  },
  "author": "",
  "license": "MIT",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/cli": "^7.19.3",
    "@babel/core": "^7.19.6",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.19.4",
    "@types/chai": "^4.3.3",
    "@types/mocha": "^10.0.0",
    "@types/sinon": "^10.0.13",
    "babel-loader": "^9.0.1",
    "chai": "^4.3.4",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-importpath-plugin": "^1.0.2",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "husky": "^8.0.1",
    "karma": "^6.4.1",
    "karma-chai": "^0.1.0",
    "karma-chrome-launcher": "^3.1.0",
    "karma-cli": "^2.0.0",
    "karma-mocha": "^2.0.1",
    "karma-sinon": "^1.0.5",
    "karma-webpack": "^5.0.0",
    "lint-staged": "^13.0.3",
    "mocha": "^10.1.0",
    "prettier": "^2.7.1",
    "sinon": "^14.0.1",
    "typescript": "^4.8.4",
    "webpack": "^5.74.0",
    "webpack-cli": "^4.10.0"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "axios": "^1.1.3",
    "core-js": "^3.26.0",
    "webpack-merge": "^4.2.2"
  }
}
name: package.json
